description:
A cross-platform ebook reader

Koodo Reader is an all-in-one ebook reader that can help you better manage and study your ebooks.
It's free and open-source.
Notes
- This is a developer release and is NOT recommended for general use. For stable releases, please visit Koodo Reader.
New Features
- Optimized User Interface.
- Improved touchpad sensitivity.
- Enhanced chapter algorithm.
- Bring back tooltips
- Added functionality to confirm modifications by pressing the enter key.
Fixes
- Fixed issue where the search page couldn't be exited by clicking the close button.
- Resolved problem of repeated highlights.
- Addressed known issue with the input box.
- Fixed non-functional Moyu mode.
- Resolved issue where books couldn't be opened with a double click when the "open books in the main window" option was enabled.
- Fixed issue where Text-to-Speech (TTS) didn't work when switching chapters.
- Fixed issue where the app icon was not displayed on Linux.
- Addressed known issue with multi-select functionality.
- Corrected improperly displayed highlights in PDFs.
- Fixed issue where the current reading chapter was not highlighted in the table of contents.
- Resolved issue where hyperlinks in PDFs couldn't be opened.
- Removed extra 0 in reading progress display.
